Moonraker is not an adpation of the novel, just an original story with Moonraker name. The last one adapted film was TMWTGG.

Well, in Jeremy's case, you'd have to use capital letters.
Then cite and quote it. Otherwise, it's absurd to have in an encyclopedic article. It'd be laughable to replace every instance of the word "penis" with "male organ" in, say, Ron Jeremy's article.

rem redirect and I think Broccoli's opinion holds more weight than Craig

Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contributions/76.230.6.145|76.230.6.145]] to version by WickerGuy. False positive? [[User:ClueBot/FalsePositives|Report it]]. Thanks, [[User:ClueBot|ClueBot]]. (493758) (Bot)
/* Films */ Undoing one-half of last edit. Policy in chart is to never double line when someone works on non-consecutive films. No double linking for Connery or other directors
/* Romancing the Bond girl */ Removing repetitive info, restructuring remainder, qualifying a few generalizations.
American spellings are among the bad edits in this rvt of everything that has worked hard for here for the past few days
/* Flirting with Moneypenny */ Exchanging order of final two paragraphs of this section.
/* Bond's persona */ Last edit's Distinction of books and films was overgeneralized and cut and dried. Also Separating Bond traits into persona, physical, aesthetic, and appearance for readability
/* Films */ OHMSS- removed reference to hideout. Added reference to Bond's incognito and collaboration with father-in-law
/* Films */ Inserting paragraph taken from the Dalton section (previous change was to delete it there) and inserting it in this section.
/* Timothy Dalton */ Moving paragraph from Dalton section to Films section about 'end of an era'. This change deletes it here. Next will put it in "films".
/* Films */ incorporating Chris42's suggestion into Living Daylights plot
